channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Basket/large paingt tub opp 60 Sydney Rd, Abbey Wood, 16th December
item.description:
Please could you arrange to collect items that were left in the street overnight. Date Observed: Friday, 12 December (early hours, before scheduled bin collection) Location: Opposite No. 60 Sydney Road, Abbey Wood, SE2 9RX Description of Items: • One basket - currently empty • One large paint tub, heavy, possibly containing paint Details: Both items appeared during the early hours of Friday, prior to the regular waste collection. These items were not part of the scheduled collection and appear to have been dumped illegally. Action Requested: Please arrange for these items to be collected from the location, which is opposite No. 60 at the earliest opportunity.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydney Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle involved in RTPC, 16th December
item.description:
Good morning I am on patrol in Lewisham and i have come across a vehicle on Courthill Road se13. The vehicle looks to have been in a road traffic collision and the vehicle has been left on a double red line by a pedestrian crossing . The vehicle can cause some issues when vehicles are turning right onto the road. Vehicle should be removed to avoid future disruption.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Courthill Road, Hither Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 16th December
item.description:
Fly tipping of hardcore rubbish and balloon canisters at the entrance to lower farm Wallhouse Road and blocking horse field. Don’t want it to get added to. Concrete post dumped down the lane also

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wallhouse Road, Slade Green, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping, 16th December
item.description:
Outside queen's apartments next door to the queen's arms pub in robertson street, sw8 are weveral grey rubbish bags full of builder's materials to which other dumped rubbish is being added daily

item.title: Missing yellow line, 16th December
item.description:
A car has been parked on the road for a number of months so the yellow line could not be painted due to the car being parked there, when the resident permit lines were done. The car has now been moved so there is now a gap in the yellow line which could cause confusion on parking rules.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Collection Not Frequent Enough, 16th December
item.description:
Serious issue regarding rubbish and over-flowing bins around Scawfell, Dunloe and Dawson st. Due to rubbish being collected only every other week, the bins over lflow; and then the residents leave bins on street corners. This leads to more littering
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dawson Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Front wall damaged by contractors, 16th December
item.description:
Reported damage to wall by contractors using ride on machine that hit my wall back in early November. Contractor supervisor called to advise that they will send some to look at damage before fixing. No further information from contractors. 2nd time wall has been hit from machine in the last couple of years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coniston Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on public area, 16th December
item.description:
Repeated refuse dumped here. Please clear & investigate to see who keeps leaving domestic waste here. It's attracting pests and it's disgusting. Maybe a fine will deter? Dumped pillows and bottles.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Scawfell Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road us closed at junction with Monks Close but there is no signage at the bottom of New Rd advising this. All cars are heading up abd having to turn around in middke of the road to go back, 16th December
item.description:
Need sign at bottom of New Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite The Constitution Pub on the canal bridge, 16th December
item.description:
I can't choose the correct location from Camden's map because this tree is growing from the other side of the bridge. It's overhanging and impedes walking particularly when dark as the branches can't be seen. Needs urgent cutting back and a sweep. Is it possible to also attach a sign to the bridge asking the public not to feed pigeons as there is regularly a pile of waste food just left which is a hazard to people walking and attracts rats from the canal. Thank you. My photo won't upload unfortunately.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regent's Canal towpath, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
